concept.title: Cold Weather Effects on the Commutator
concept.shortdesc: Cold temperatures can cause lubricating oil in the commutator to congeal, preventing proper contact between the roller and contact points and leading to difficult starting conditions.

section.title: Oil Congealing Problems
section.p: In cold weather, even high-quality lubricating oils tend to congeal. Within the commutator, this congealing creates two specific problems:

ul.li: The roller cannot make perfect contact with the fiber-embedded contact points
The roller arm spring lacks sufficient strength to clear away the oil film covering the contact points

section.title: Symptoms
section.p: During cold-weather starts, you may notice that only one or two cylinders fire initially. This limited firing pattern indicates imperfect contact across the four terminals due to congealed oil.
